message.content: Search the web for "Adobe Premiere Pro UXP sample plugin github" or "ppro-scripting-api examples". Find sample code that shows how to modify clip properties on the timeline. Look for any examples that rename clips or set clip metadata.

input.query: Adobe Premiere Pro UXP sample plugin github

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Adobe Premiere Pro UXP sample plugin github"

Links: [{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"},{"title":"uxp-premiere-pro-samples/README.md at main · AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples/blob/main/README.md"},{"title":"GitHub - hetpatel-11/Adobe_Premiere_Pro_MCP: Adobe Premiere Pro MCP","url":"https://github.com/hetpatel-11/Adobe_Premiere_Pro_MCP"},{"title":"Get started - UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/getting-started/"},{"title":"Building your first UXP plugin","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro"},{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro panels - Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/ReadMe.md"},{"title":"Starters and samples","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/resources/starters-samples/"},{"title":"GitHub - cameron-astor/jumpcut: An open-source jump cut plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro.","url":"https://github.com/cameron-astor/jumpcut"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Adobe Premiere Pro UXP sample plugins on GitHub:

## Official Adobe UXP Sample Plugins Repository

The main repository for Adobe Premiere Pro UXP sample plugins is:

**[AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples)**

These instructions explain how to develop UXP plugins within Premiere Pro.(no content)As of August 2025, only Premiere Pro BETA builds support UXP plugins.

### Requirements
- Premiere Pro BETA build, available through Creative Cloud Desktop.
- UXP Developer Tool, also available for download through Creative Cloud Desktop.

### Getting Started
Get the Adobe third-party sample panel from the premiere-api directory from this Git repository. Open your console / terminal / command prompt, into sample-panels/premiere-api/html.(no content)The plugin is now built in the /build-html directory.

### Features
- You can now see and use TypeScript definitions for Premiere Pro's UXP APIs, in Visual Studio Code.
- The repository includes Premiere Pro's transcript JSON definition, in the assets directory, within the premiere-api sample plugin.

### Documentation
The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/

## Additional Resources

- When building UXP plugins for Premiere, you don't need to start from scratch. Adobe provides samples (complete, working examples that demonstrate specific features or use cases) and starters (minimal templates with framework setup to help you begin a new plugin project).

- As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions to Premiere Pro have been superseded by UXP Extensibility. If you are starting new development, start in UXP. CEP extensions continue to be supported; the plan is to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which they will remove support for CEP extensibility.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Solved: Editing clips with ExtendScript - Adobe Product Community - 9056625","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/editing-clips-with-extendscript/td-p/9056625"},{"title":"Access the Frame Rate of a Premiere Pro Clip using ExtendScript","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/frame-rate-of-premiere-pro-clip-extendscript/"},{"title":"Solved: add/remove track in timeline (using CEP PPRO api) - Adobe Product Community - 15551673","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/add-remove-track-in-timeline-using-cep-ppro-api/m-p/15551673"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"Premiere 2019 - New API Features - PremiereOnScript","url":"https://premiereonscript.com/premiere-2019-new-api-features/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting: Set In and Out Points of Clip","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-set-in-and-out-points-of-clip/td-p/10490225"},{"title":"Solved: Re: PPro Scripting: Algorithm to get selected clip... - Adobe Product Community - 15409855","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/ppro-scripting-algorithm-to-get-selected-clips-as-qe-items/m-p/15410134"},{"title":"Solved: Re: How to export an EDL from a timeline using Ext... - Adobe Product Community - 9721600","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/how-to-export-an-edl-from-a-timeline-using-extendscript/m-p/9721602"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about the Premiere Pro Scripting API for clip properties and timeline operations:

## Premiere Pro Scripting API - Clip Properties and Timeline Examples

### Accessing Clips in Timeline

You can access clip properties through the path: `app.project.sequences[index].videoTracks[index].clips[index].components[index].properties[index]`(no content)The ComponentParam object represents a parameter associated with a component, applied to a TrackItem object.

### Sequence (Timeline) Object

The Sequence object represents sequences of media, or 'timelines', in Premiere Pro.

Key sequence properties include:
- The time, in ticks, of the end of the sequence (String; read-only).
- The horizontal frame size, or width, of the sequence. Set this attribute with the Sequence.setSettings() method (Integer; read-only).
- An array of audio Track objects in the sequence (TrackCollection object; read-only).

### Clip Properties Available

Using the CueSheeter approach, you can access the following track clip properties: name, start, end, duration, speed, reversed, type, mediaType, frameBlend, timeInterpolationType, scaleToFrameSize, multicamEnabled, numComponents.

### Getting Selected Clips

You can retrieve the selected clip in the Premiere Pro timeline using the getSelection() method of the activeSequence object.

### Setting In/Out Points

It's recommended to set the in/out points of the projectItem before you insert a clip into the sequence.(no content)setInPoint() and setOutPoint() methods work in CC 2019, but did not exist for project items in CC 2017.

### Official Sample Code

The PProPanel sample exercises Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API and is available at: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/tree/master/PProPanel

### API Transition Note

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported and the plan is for them to remain so through September 2026.

### Limitations

PPro offers no supported API for adding/removing tracks via ExtendScript.(no content)Mimicking in-timeline editing is not possible through ExtendScript, but you can try to mimic classical 3-point editing through a script if your marker information allows you to calculate the time values for the source clips.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.content:
# UXP Premiere Pro Sample Plugin Overview

Based on the provided content, there is **one primary sample plugin directory** mentioned:

## Sample Plugin Directory

**`sample-panels/premiere-api/html`** - This is the main Adobe third-party sample panel for UXP development in Premiere Pro.

### What the Sample Does

The README indicates this is a foundational demonstration plugin that showcases UXP API capabilities for Premiere Pro BETA builds. However, the specific functionality details regarding clip modification, clip naming, or timeline item manipulation are **not described in the provided content**.

### Key Features Included

The documentation references:
- TypeScript definition support for IDE autocomplete
- "Premiere Pro's transcript JSON definition" located in the `assets` directory
- General UXP API implementation patterns

### Limitation

The exact sample code functionality—whether it demonstrates clip editing, timeline operations, or other specific tasks—cannot be determined from this page's content alone. To learn what the sample actually does, you would need to examine the source code in the `sample-panels/premiere-api/html` directory or consult the official documentation at `developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/`.

Based on my search results, here's what I found about the Premiere Pro UXP API clip name property and TrackItem:

## TrackItem Name Property

### ExtendScript API
In the ExtendScript API, TrackItem has a `name` property that represents the name of the track item, and it is read/write (String type).(no content)As of Premiere Pro CC v12.0.0 (at least), TrackItem objects have a read+write name property. Setting that value allows you to change the name of the clip instance in the sequence timeline.

### UXP API

In the UXP API, TrackItem provides a method called `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` which "Returns an action that renames the trackItem".

This is an important distinction: An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous and blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread. For a smooth transition, all properties (get and set) in the API were designed to be synchronous and do not need to be awaited.

## Key Differences

In the **UXP API**, instead of a direct `setName()` method or writable property, you use an action-based approach:
- `createSetNameAction(inName: string)` - Creates an Action object that can rename the track item

## Current Status

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.(no content)No further changes to ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled; for now, Adobe is focused on getting UXP extensibility to 1:1 parity with what's possible via CEP+ExtendScript.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text: Let me fetch the UXP API reference documentation and the TypeScript definitions to find more details about clip properties and the action-based approach.

input.prompt: Find all methods and properties related to TrackItem, clips, and setting clip names or metadata. Look for createSetNameAction and any other methods that modify clip properties.
Extract all TrackItem methods and properties. Look for setName, createSetNameAction, and any methods related to renaming clips or setting clip metadata.

content.content: Prompt is too long

# TrackItem Methods and Properties

Based on the TypeScript definitions provided, here are the relevant TrackItem methods and properties for renaming and metadata:

## AudioClipTrackItem
- `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` — "Returns an action that renames the trackItem"
- `getName(): Promise<string>` — Returns display name for trackItem
- `getMatchName(): Promise<string>` — Returns internal matchname value

## VideoClipTrackItem
- `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` — "Returns an action that renames the trackItem"
- `getName(): Promise<string>` — Returns display name for trackItem
- `getMatchName(): Promise<string>` — Returns internal matchname value

## Key Pattern
Both audio and video clip track items follow the same naming convention:
- **Getter**: `getName()` retrieves the current name
- **Action Creator**: `createSetNameAction()` generates an undoable action for renaming
- **Internal Reference**: `getMatchName()` accesses the internal identifier

The `createSetNameAction()` method is the primary mechanism for renaming track items in a way that integrates with Premiere Pro's undo system.

Links: [{"title":"How to use 'Action' in PremierePro UXP? - Premiere Pro - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/how-to-use-action-in-premierepro-uxp/8867"},{"title":"Help with the new UXP createInsertProjectItemAction() method. \"Script Action failed to execute\"","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/help-with-the-new-uxp-createinsertprojectitemaction-method-quot-script-action-failed-to-execute-quot/m-p/15239302"},{"title":"GitHub - jardicc/am-to-uxp: Polyfill for support AM code in UXP","url":"https://github.com/jardicc/am-to-uxp"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"},{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"Premiere and UXP","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/introduction/"},{"title":"Panels and Commands","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/plugins/concepts/panels-and-commands/"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"Premiere API—UXP for Adobe Premiere","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP executeAction and compound actions:

## Key Findings

### Using Actions in Premiere Pro UXP

There are developers actively looking for guidance on how to use 'Action' in Premiere Pro UXP, including methods like `createSetInPointAction`, `createAppendComponentAction`, and `createBinAction`.

### executeAction with createInsertProjectItemAction Example

A key finding is that developers initially tried to execute the `createInsertProjectItemAction()` method by assigning it to a variable first, then passing that variable into an `executeAction()` function, then into the `executeTransaction()` method. However, it was discovered that the `createInsertProjectItemAction()` method only works correctly when nested inside of the `project.executeTransaction()` method.(no content)The method signature requires the following parameters: `SequenceEditor.createInsertProjectItemAction(projectItem, TickTime, videoTrackIndex, audioTrackIndex, limitShift)`.

### Official Resources

The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.(no content)Adobe provides a third-party sample panel called "premiere-api" in their Git repository, which you can access by navigating to sample-panels/premiere-api/html.

### UXP Architecture Notes

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

### Current Status

As of August 2025, only Premiere Pro BETA builds support UXP plugins.(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported through September 2026.

For more specific examples of compound actions using `executeAction`, you may want to check the official Adobe sample panels repository at https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples or the Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums for more detailed code examples.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

results:
Based on the search results, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP executeAction and compound actions:

## Key Findings

### Using Actions in Premiere Pro UXP

There are developers actively looking for guidance on how to use 'Action' in Premiere Pro UXP, including methods like `createSetInPointAction`, `createAppendComponentAction`, and `createBinAction`.

### executeAction with createInsertProjectItemAction Example

A key finding is that developers initially tried to execute the `createInsertProjectItemAction()` method by assigning it to a variable first, then passing that variable into an `executeAction()` function, then into the `executeTransaction()` method. However, it was discovered that the `createInsertProjectItemAction()` method only works correctly when nested inside of the `project.executeTransaction()` method.(no content)The method signature requires the following parameters: `SequenceEditor.createInsertProjectItemAction(projectItem, TickTime, videoTrackIndex, audioTrackIndex, limitShift)`.

### Official Resources

The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.(no content)Adobe provides a third-party sample panel called "premiere-api" in their Git repository, which you can access by navigating to sample-panels/premiere-api/html.

### UXP Architecture Notes

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread.

### Current Status

As of August 2025, only Premiere Pro BETA builds support UXP plugins.(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported through September 2026.

For more specific examples of compound actions using `executeAction`, you may want to check the official Adobe sample panels repository at https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples or the Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums for more detailed code examples.

input.prompt: Extract the complete TrackItem interface and any related interfaces like VideoClipTrackItem and AudioClipTrackItem. Show all methods and properties available for track items.

content.content:
# TrackItem Interfaces in Premiere Pro SDK

## VideoClipTrackItem

**Methods:**
- `createAddVideoTransitionAction()` - Add video transitions to track items
- `createRemoveVideoTransitionAction()` - Remove video transitions
- `getMatchName()` - Retrieve internal matchname
- `getName()` - Get display name
- `getIsSelected()` - Check selection status
- `getSpeed()` - Obtain playback speed value
- `isAdjustmentLayer()` - Determine if adjustment layer
- `isSpeedReversed()` - Check reverse status
- `createMoveAction()` - Shift item by time offset
- `getInPoint()` / `getOutPoint()` - Access media boundaries
- `createSetInPointAction()` / `createSetOutPointAction()` - Modify media points
- `getStartTime()` / `getEndTime()` - Access sequence positions
- `createSetStartAction()` / `createSetEndAction()` - Modify sequence timing
- `getDuration()` - Calculate item length
- `getType()` - Identify item type (clip, transition, etc.)
- `isDisabled()` - Check mute/disable state
- `createSetDisabledAction()` - Enable/disable items
- `createSetNameAction()` - Rename items
- `getMediaType()` - Retrieve UUID for media type
- `getTrackIndex()` - Determine track location
- `getProjectItem()` - Access underlying project item
- `getComponentChain()` - Access video effects chain

**Properties:**
Same as methods but as readable attributes where applicable.

## AudioClipTrackItem

Mirrors VideoClipTrackItem functionality but for audio, including:
- All timing and positioning methods
- `getComponentChain()` returning `AudioComponentChain`
- Excludes transition-specific methods

## Key Enumerations

Track item types accessible via `Constants.TrackItemType`:
- EMPTY, CLIP, TRANSITION, PREVIEW, FEEDBACK

**Methods:**
- `createAddVideoTransitionAction()` - Add video transitions to track items
- `createRemoveVideoTransitionAction()` - Remove video transitions

- `getIsSelected()` - Check selection status

- `isAdjustmentLayer()` - Determine if adjustment layer
- `isSpeedReversed()` - Check reverse status
- `createMoveAction()` - Shift item by time offset
- `getInPoint()` / `getOutPoint()` - Access media boundaries
- `createSetInPointAction()` / `createSetOutPointAction()` - Modify media points
- `getStartTime()` / `getEndTime()` - Access sequence positions

Here's what I found regarding Premiere Pro UXP APIs for clip labels, color, metadata, and markers:

## UXP API for Labels and Colors

The Premiere Pro UXP API provides methods for working with clip label colors, including `getColorLabelIndex()` which returns a Promise<number> to get the color label index of a projectItem, and `createSetColorLabelAction(inColorLabelIndex: number)` which creates an action for setting a color label to a projectItem by index.

## UXP API for Markers

The API includes `getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem)` which returns the Markers object for a Sequence or ProjectItem. You can also use `createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime)` to move a marker to a new time value, and `createAddMarkerAction()` to add new markers.

## UXP API for Metadata

For metadata operations, the UXP API provides `createSetProjectMetadataAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, metadata: string, updatedFields: string[])` for setting project metadata, `createSetXMPMetadataAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, metadata: string)` for setting XMP metadata, `addPropertyToProjectMetadataSchema(name: string, label: string, type: number)` to add properties to the project metadata schema, and `getProjectColumnsMetadata(projectItem: ProjectItem)` to get project column metadata from a project item.

## Important Limitation

"In PPro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems, are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem."(no content)Each projectItem has XMP metadata which includes markers, and width/height info is included in that.

## Markers Panel in Premiere Pro

The Markers panel (Window > Markers) allows you to view and manage all markers in an open clip or sequence. You can double-click a marker to view its properties in detail.

## Write Clip Markers to XMP

There's a preference setting called "Write clip markers to XMP" hiding in the preference panel under the "Media" tab. This is considered one of the most important features added to Premiere because it addresses backup, archive, project sharing, and helps with online/offline workflows.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Here's what I found regarding Premiere Pro UXP APIs for clip labels, color, metadata, and markers:

## UXP API for Labels and Colors

The Premiere Pro UXP API provides methods for working with clip label colors, including `getColorLabelIndex()` which returns a Promise<number> to get the color label index of a projectItem, and `createSetColorLabelAction(inColorLabelIndex: number)` which creates an action for setting a color label to a projectItem by index.

## UXP API for Markers

The API includes `getMarkers(markerOwnerObject: Sequence | ClipProjectItem)` which returns the Markers object for a Sequence or ProjectItem. You can also use `createMoveMarkerAction(marker: Marker, tickTime: TickTime)` to move a marker to a new time value, and `createAddMarkerAction()` to add new markers.

## UXP API for Metadata

For metadata operations, the UXP API provides `createSetProjectMetadataAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, metadata: string, updatedFields: string[])` for setting project metadata, `createSetXMPMetadataAction(projectItem: ProjectItem, metadata: string)` for setting XMP metadata, `addPropertyToProjectMetadataSchema(name: string, label: string, type: number)` to add properties to the project metadata schema, and `getProjectColumnsMetadata(projectItem: ProjectItem)` to get project column metadata from a project item.

## Important Limitation

"In PPro, all markers and metadata associated with trackItems, are actually attached to the backing projectItem; it's not possible to have different markers and metadata for each trackItem."(no content)Each projectItem has XMP metadata which includes markers, and width/height info is included in that.

## Markers Panel in Premiere Pro

The Markers panel (Window > Markers) allows you to view and manage all markers in an open clip or sequence. You can double-click a marker to view its properties in detail.

## Write Clip Markers to XMP

There's a preference setting called "Write clip markers to XMP" hiding in the preference panel under the "Media" tab. This is considered one of the most important features added to Premiere because it addresses backup, archive, project sharing, and helps with online/offline workflows.

input.prompt: Extract any code examples showing how to work with clips, set label colors, or modify clip properties in Premiere Pro UXP.

content.content:
# UXP Code Examples for Clips and Properties

Based on the provided web page content, **there are no code examples showing how to work with clips, set label colors, or modify clip properties in Premiere Pro UXP**.

The page is a forum discussion thread titled "UXP: Razor tool and marking clipped sections" where a user asks about creating cut sections and marking them programmatically. The response from an Adobe Employee states:

> "There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."

The thread confirms that while some tasks are possible (placing trackItems in sequences, exporting SRT files, extracting metadata), **the UXP APIs do not currently provide functionality for the specific operations you're asking about**. The discussion suggests falling back to CEP/ExtendScript if those capabilities are required.

The page is a forum discussion thread titled "UXP: Razor tool and marking clipped sections" where a user asks about creating cut sections and marking them programmatically. The response from an Adobe Employee states:

> "There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."

The thread confirms that while some tasks are possible (placing trackItems in sequences, exporting SRT files, extracting metadata), **the UXP APIs do not currently provide functionality for the specific operations you're asking about**. The discussion suggests falling back to CEP/ExtendScript if those capabilities are required.

Here are the search results for the GitHub query about AdobeDocs uxp-premiere-pro-samples main.js:

## Main Repository

The **AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples** repository contains UXP Developer Tool samples, including the Adobe third-party sample panel in the premiere-api directory.

### Getting Started

To use the samples, open your console/terminal into sample-panels/premiere-api/html, build the plugin (which outputs to the /build-html directory), launch Premiere Pro Beta, load UDT, click Add Plugin, and navigate to premiere-api/build-html/manifest.json.

### TypeScript Support

To see definitions, add typescript definitions to the .js file in which you are working. Copy types.d.ts to the root of the /html directory, and you can then see and use TypeScript definitions for Premiere Pro's UXP APIs in Visual Studio Code.

## Important Note About CEP vs UXP

As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions to Premiere Pro have been superseded by UXP Extensibility. If you are starting new development, start in UXP. CEP extensions continue to be supported, with the plan to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which support for CEP extensibility will be removed.

### Related Resources
- Repository: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples
- Documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ and the Premiere Pro UXP Developer Forum at https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/c/uxp-for-premiere-pro/105

Note: The search did not return specific `main.js` file content from the repository. You may want to browse the repository directly at https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples to find specific JavaScript files.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

This appears to be an Adobe UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform) panel for Premiere Pro, structured as a Node.js project with TypeScript support.

Based on my search results, I found information about the `createSetColorLabelAction` method in Premiere Pro's UXP API, though I didn't find a complete example code snippet. Here's what I can tell you:

## createSetColorLabelAction in Premiere Pro UXP

The `createSetColorLabelAction(inColorLabelIndex: number): Action` method is used to create an action for setting a color label to a projectItem by index.(no content)This method is available on ProjectItem objects (including FolderItem or ClipProjectItem cast to ProjectItem) and can be used to create an action for setting color labels.

### API Context

An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, meaning they blocked the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, a method call is asynchronous and does not block the UI thread.

### How to Use (General Pattern)

Based on the TypeScript definitions found in the UXP documentation, here's how you would typically use this method:

```javascript
const { app } = require("premierepro");

// Get the active project and a project item
const project = await app.getActiveProject();
const rootItem = await project.getRootItem();
const children = await rootItem.getChildren();
const projectItem = children[0]; // Get first project item

// Create the color label action (color index 0-16)
const setColorAction = projectItem.createSetColorLabelAction(3); // e.g., index 3 for a specific color

// Execute the action
await setColorAction.execute();
```

### Resources for More Examples

Adobe provides sample UXP plugins for Premiere Pro development. The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.(no content)Adobe has updated their sample code in the Sample SDK, which provides practical examples of how to interact with the Premiere API using UXP.

For complete working examples, I recommend checking:
- The [UXP Premiere Pro Samples repository](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples)
- The [official Premiere UXP API documentation](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/classes/projectitem/)


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Web search results for query: ""renameFirstSelectedTrackItem" OR "createSetNameAction" site:github.com premiere uxp"

Links: [{"title":"uxp-premiere-pro/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts at main · AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts"}]

Based on my search, I found relevant information about the `createSetNameAction` function in the Adobe UXP Premiere Pro documentation on GitHub.

## Search Results

The search found the function in the **AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro** repository, specifically in the TypeScript definitions file:

### `createSetNameAction` Method

The `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` method returns an action that renames the trackItem.

This method appears in multiple contexts within the Premiere Pro UXP API:

1. **TrackItem**: `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` returns an action that renames the trackItem, along with other methods like `getMediaType()` which returns a UUID representing the underlying media type, and `getTrackIndex()` which returns the index representing the track this track item belongs to.

2. **ProjectItem**: `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` returns an action that renames a projectItem. Related methods include `getColorLabelIndex()` to get the color label index, and `createSetColorLabelAction(inColorLabelIndex: number)` to set the color label.

3. **Marker**: `createSetNameAction(name: string): Action` returns an action to set the name of a marker.

The search did not return any results specifically for `renameFirstSelectedTrackItem` - this function name may not exist in the current Premiere Pro UXP API, or it might be a custom function built on top of the `createSetNameAction` API.

**Source**: [uxp-premiere-pro/types.d.ts on GitHub](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts)


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

### `createSetNameAction` Method

The `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` method returns an action that renames the trackItem.

This method appears in multiple contexts within the Premiere Pro UXP API:

1. **TrackItem**: `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` returns an action that renames the trackItem, along with other methods like `getMediaType()` which returns a UUID representing the underlying media type, and `getTrackIndex()` which returns the index representing the track this track item belongs to.

2. **ProjectItem**: `createSetNameAction(inName: string): Action` returns an action that renames a projectItem. Related methods include `getColorLabelIndex()` to get the color label index, and `createSetColorLabelAction(inColorLabelIndex: number)` to set the color label.

3. **Marker**: `createSetNameAction(name: string): Action` returns an action to set the name of a marker.

The search did not return any results specifically for `renameFirstSelectedTrackItem` - this function name may not exist in the current Premiere Pro UXP API, or it might be a custom function built on top of the `createSetNameAction` API.

**Source**: [uxp-premiere-pro/types.d.ts on GitHub](https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro/blob/main/src/pages/ppro_reference/types.d.ts)

content.content:
# Analysis of Premiere Pro Project Management Code

This TypeScript file contains Adobe Premiere Pro API wrapper functions for project management operations. Here's what I found:

## What the Code Contains

The file provides async functions that wrap Premiere Pro's native API, including:

- Project opening and closing operations
- Sequence management (retrieving active sequence, all sequences, opening specific sequences)
- Project persistence (save, save-as)
- Color settings retrieval (including graphics white luminance values)
- Project state management (pause growing, insertion bin access)

## Regarding Your Specific Query

**The code does NOT include examples of setting project item properties, color labels, or metadata.** All color-related functions are **read-only**, such as `getColorSettings()` and `getCurrentGraphicsWhiteLuminance()`. 

The file focuses on retrieving project information rather than modifying project metadata or item properties. There are no functions that demonstrate how to assign color labels to clips, set custom metadata fields, or modify item properties.

If you need to work with those capabilities, you would need to consult additional Adobe Premiere Pro API documentation or other code modules not included in this file.

content.content:
# Functions That Modify Track Items, Clips, or Sequence Elements

This Adobe Premiere Pro API file contains several functions designed to alter sequence and clip properties:

## Sequence Modification Functions

**`setSequenceSettings()`** - Adjusts video properties including pixel aspect ratio (set to Square) and frame rate (32.987 fps) using a compound transaction.

**`setSequenceInOutPoint()`** - Establishes the sequence's in-point at zero and out-point at the end time through locked access and transactions.

**`setActiveSequence()`** - Activates a specified sequence within the project.

**`createSequence()` and `createSequenceFromMedia()`** - Generate new sequences, with the latter building one from selected media items.

## Track Item Modification Functions

**`setSequenceSelection()`** - Selects the first video clip track item on the primary video track.

**`trimSelectedItem()`** - Reduces a selected item's duration by one second using "a compound action" that modifies the end time.

**`addHandlesToTrackItem()`** - The most complex function, adding media handles to track item start/end points. It accounts for timebase ratios between source and sequence, preventing modifications that exceed media boundaries.

**`renameFirstSelectedTrackItem()`** - Renames the first selected track item to "TrackItem 1" through locked access.

All modification functions employ `project.lockedAccess()` and `project.executeTransaction()` patterns to ensure atomic operations.

**`setActiveSequence()`** - Activates a specified sequence within the project.

**`createSequence()` and `createSequenceFromMedia()`** - Generate new sequences, with the latter building one from selected media items.

## Track Item Modification Functions

**`renameFirstSelectedTrackItem()`** - Renames the first selected track item to "TrackItem 1" through locked access.

All modification functions employ `project.lockedAccess()` and `project.executeTransaction()` patterns to ensure atomic operations.

Show the complete source code for working with markers, including adding and modifying markers.

content.content:
# Adobe Premiere Pro Marker Management Source Code

This TypeScript module provides comprehensive marker functionality for Adobe Premiere Pro projects. Here's what the code covers:

## Key Functions

**Marker Creation:**
The code includes four distinct marker creation functions:
- `createMarkerComment()` - adds comment markers at 0.0 seconds
- `createMarkerChapter()` - adds chapter markers at 0.5 seconds
- `createMarkerWeblink()` - adds weblink markers at 1.0 seconds
- `createMarkerFlashCuePoint()` - adds Flash Cue Point markers at 1.5 seconds

**Marker Modification:**
- `moveMarker()` - repositions an existing marker to 3.0 seconds
- `removeMarker()` - deletes all markers from a sequence
- `setFirstSequenceMarkerColor()` - changes the first marker's color to blue

**Marker Information Retrieval:**
- `getMarkerObjects()` - retrieves both sequence and clip marker objects
- `getSequenceMarkerInfo()` - extracts marker details including name, type, color, and color index

## Implementation Pattern

All modification functions follow a consistent workflow: they obtain locked access to the project, execute a transaction with compound actions, and return a success boolean. The code demonstrates proper error handling with try-catch blocks and logging utilities throughout.

content.content:
# Metadata Modification in Adobe Premiere Pro

The source code provides several functions for setting metadata on project items:

## Key Functions

**setXMPMetadata()** - Copies XMP metadata from one project item to another by:
1. Retrieving XMP metadata from the first item
2. Creating a "setXMPMetadataAction" 
3. Executing it within a transaction using `project.lockedAccess()`

**setProjectMetadata()** - Modifies project-level metadata by:
1. Creating an action with `createSetProjectMetadataAction()` 
2. Specifying XML-formatted metadata and "updatedFields" array
3. Executing within a locked transaction

**setProjectPanelMetadata()** - Updates the project panel's metadata configuration using XML paths defining namespaces and metadata entries.

**addPropertiesToMetadataSchema()** - Extends the metadata schema by adding new properties with specified types (e.g., TEXT).

## Pattern

All modification functions follow this sequence: create the action → wrap in `project.lockedAccess()` → execute via `project.executeTransaction()`. This ensures thread-safe modifications to the Adobe Premiere Pro project.

Note: The code doesn't show direct color label modification—only metadata manipulation through XMP and project metadata schemas.

content.content:
# Source Code Analysis

The provided content shows the complete source code for an Adobe Premiere Pro property management module. Here are the key functions that manipulate properties:

## Property-Setting Functions

**setSampleSequenceProperty()** - This function sets a new property on a sequence object. It uses `properties.createSetValueAction()` to create an action that assigns a value (88) to a property named "Sample" with a `NON_PERSISTENT` type. The action executes within a transaction wrapped in `project.lockedAccess()`.

**clearSampleSequenceProperty()** - This function removes an existing property from a sequence. It first verifies the property exists, then uses `properties.createClearValueAction()` to remove the "Sample" property through a project transaction.

## Key Technical Details

Both functions operate within Adobe's locking and transaction mechanisms:
- Actions use `project.lockedAccess()` to ensure thread safety
- Changes execute via `project.executeTransaction()` for atomic operations
- The code doesn't directly set color labels; it manages custom properties generically

The module imports `premierepro` type definitions and provides utility logging for error handling and user feedback during property operations.
